short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Fetches IFD data from BOM and rainfall data from ARR based on coordinates.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Rainfall IFD Fetcher

Rainfall IFD Fetcher is a simple  tool that allows users to retrieve Intensity-Frequency-Duration (IFD) rainfall data from the Bureau of Meteorology (BOM), as well as rainfall data from the Australian Rainfall and Runoff (ARR) database. By entering latitude and longitude coordinates, users can quickly access rainfall information essential for hydrological and stormwater analysis.

Get the latitudes and longitudes quickly by entering your location on google maps and right clicking.

Key Features:
1. Fetch IFD rainfall data directly from BOM based on user-entered coordinates.
2. Retrieve rainfall data from ARR for specific locations across Australia.
3. Supports coordinates in decimal degrees for precise location-based data.
4. Easy-to-use interface, with a map of Australia for better visual orientation.

Whether you're working in hydrology, flood modeling, or stormwater management, Rainfall IFD Fetcher simplifies access to critical rainfall data with just a few clicks.
